name: 50x
description: Launched on 25/10/2018, 50x.com is a centralized exchange registered in Kingstown, Saint Vincent and the Grenadines. 50x.com claims to be the first cryptocurrency exchange with an Any2Any trading core that supports direct trades between all listed coins. Powered by A2A technology with automated liquidity aggregation, 50x.com allows users to trade any listed coin to any other listed coin directly in one trade, with the benefits of the fair open market with trader's tools like stop losses, trailing stops, token loans, and Professional Managed Accounts.

name: ACDX
description: A cryptocurrency derivatives exchange offering spot trading, delta one products, and structured products, launched on September 29, 2020, catering to crypto traders with a comprehensive range of financial instruments. It aims to serve both novice and experienced traders by capitalizing on the growing interest in crypto derivatives.

name: ACE
description: Centralized fiat-currency exchange headquartered in Taipei, Taiwan. Launched on October 11, 2018, it supports New Taiwan Dollar (TWD) fiat pairs and offers services for fiat deposits and withdrawals, as well as facilitating Initial Exchange Offerings (IEOs). Its platform primarily caters to the Taiwanese market and TWD-based crypto transactions.

name: Alcor
description: Since its inception in February 2020, Alcor Exchange has been at the forefront of the decentralized finance (DeFi) movement on the WAX blockchain. Known for its robust and innovative trading solutions, Alcor has become a key player in the DEX landscape.

name: ApeSwap (BSC)
description: ApeSwap is an Automated Market Maker, Yield Farming, and Staking platform on Binance Smart Chain (forked from PancakeSwap).

name: ApeSwap (Polygon)
description: ApeSwap is a leading decentralized exchange (DEX) on Binance Smart Chain and Polygon focused on offering a premier trading experience.

name: APX
description: APX Finance (APX) is the foremost decentralized exchange (DEX) for crypto derivatives on BNB Chain. Offering both order book (BNB Chain, Ethereum, Arbitrum, zkSync, BASE, Manta) and on-chain perpetuals (BNB Chain, Arbitrum).

name: APROBIT
description: A centralized exchange launched on January 6, 2020, based in the Republic of Korea. It supports trading in Korean Won (KRW) and US Dollar (USD) fiat pairs and allows fiat deposits and withdrawals in KRW.

name: Azbit
description: A cryptocurrency exchange launched on December 28, 2019. Advised by Bitcoin.com founder Roger Ver, Azbit offers spot crypto trading, wallets, staking, savings, and Initial Exchange Offerings (IEO). In its three-plus years of operation, Azbit has successfully listed over 400 cryptocurrency projects. The platform aims to bridge the gap between traditional finance and the crypto world, providing a comprehensive suite of services for users to engage with digital assets. With its diverse offerings and ambitious goals, Azbit seeks to establish itself as a significant player in the evolving cryptocurrency ecosystem.

name: BabySwap
description: BabySwap is a decentralized exchange (DEX) on the Binance Smart Chain, specializing in newly launched projects. It combines an automated market maker (AMM) with NFT functionality, offering a user-friendly trading environment and enhanced project support. This platform stands out for its focus on emerging projects, providing them with better visibility and resources. BabySwap's unique approach aims to create a more accessible and supportive ecosystem for both new projects and traders in the decentralized finance (DeFi) space.

name: BakerySwap
description: BakerySwap positions itself as an improved version of Uniswap with faster transactions and lower fees. It rewards liquidity providers with BAKE tokens, which earn a portion of trading fees and allow participation in governance decisions, aiming for a more efficient decentralized exchange experience.

name: Balanced
description: A user-friendly DeFi platform designed for widespread adoption, offering fast, affordable, and easy-to-use services. It provides an optimal experience for users seeking to leverage their cryptocurrency holdings while delivering higher returns compared to traditional banking.

name: Balancer
description: Balancer is a decentralized finance (DeFi) protocol that serves multiple functions in the cryptocurrency ecosystem. As a non-custodial portfolio manager, it allows users to maintain control of their assets while optimizing their investment strategies. The protocol also acts as a liquidity provider, facilitating efficient trading of various tokens. Additionally, Balancer functions as a price sensor, helping to determine accurate market prices for digital assets. With the introduction of Balancer V2, the platform has evolved to offer a more versatile and generalized protocol for automated market makers (AMMs), enhancing its capabilities in decentralized trading and liquidity provision.

name: Balancer v2 (Ethereum)
description: Balancer is a non-custodial portfolio manager, liquidity provider, and price sensor protocol. Balancer V2 offers a generalized protocol for automated market makers.

name: BCEX Korea
description: Launched on 18/03/2019, BCEX KR is a centralized exchange based in Korea.

name: Bilaxy
description: A centralized cryptocurrency exchange registered in Seychelles, launched in April 2018. Claims to serve hundreds of thousands of traders from over 80 countries worldwide. Emphasizes liquidity for new tokens and offers more than 150 crypto trading pairs. Aims to become a leading global trading platform by providing a wide array of products and services. Prioritizes transparency, reliability, quality execution, and client services to cater to global crypto traders' needs.

name: Binance
description: Binance is the world's largest cryptocurrency exchange, boasting $76 billion daily trading volume and 90 million customers globally. Founded in 2017 by Changpeng Zhao and Yi He, it offers a comprehensive ecosystem including trading, storage, and access to over 350 cryptocurrencies. Binance charges tiered fees, with regular users paying 0.10% for spot trading. The platform supports margin trading with up to 10X leverage and offers derivatives products. While Binance operates globally, it faces restrictions in several countries, including the United States, where a separate platform, Binance.US, was launched in 2019. The company has expanded its services to include ventures like Binance Labs, Launchpad, and NFT marketplace.

name: Binance TR
description: A digital asset marketplace launched in September 2020, operated by BN Teknoloji in Istanbul, Turkey. Uses licensed Binance technologies for secure transactions with Turkish Lira, supporting BTC, ETH, and USDT with a 0.1% transaction fee using a Maker-Taker model. Offers spot trading, liquidity features, security through the Binance SAFU fund, and complies with local laws. It does not serve clients in Canada, Japan, or the US.

name: Binance.US
description: Binance.US is the U.S.-regulated arm of global cryptocurrency exchange Binance, offering over 120 assets and 60+ trading pairs. Managed independently by BAM Trading Services, it is headquartered in Palo Alto, California.

name: BingX
description: Founded in 2018, BingX is a leading global crypto exchange serving over 10 million users worldwide. It offers diverse products including spot, derivatives, copy trading, and asset management. In 2024, BingX became Chelsea FC's principal partner. Founded by Lee, BingX operates globally with offices in multiple continents. The platform supports over 700 cryptocurrencies and trading pairs, with popular assets including BTC, ETH, and XRP. BingX charges a 0.1% handling fee for spot trading and up to 0.05% for futures trading. Users can leverage up to 125 times for crypto futures trading. However, BingX's services are restricted in several countries, including the US, UK, and Canada.

name: Birake Exchange
description: Launched in Dec 2018, Birake is a decentralized exchange based in Estonia. Birake's mission is to offer both exchange owners and users of Birake exchange the largest database of orders/ users while achieving high trade volumes. Birake aims to connect exchanges from its network and share orders/assets between them.

name: BIT
description: BIT is a full-featured cryptocurrency exchange that is designed for use by professionals. It provides services such as the execution of trading strategies, price discovery, and liquidity provision. BIT is always working to encourage the creation of innovative new financial products, improve the trading tools available to users, and offer a wide variety of tokens. Trade with confidence knowing that the platform is built with institutional-grade security and risk management measures in place.

name: Bitazza
description: Established in 2018, Bitazza is a centralized digital asset platform licensed by Thailand's SEC and Ministry of Finance, offering institutional-grade services, including smart routing of domestic orders to international markets with high liquidity. The ecosystem features a utility token, fiat-backed stablecoin, Visa card, and blockchain-based payment solution. It provides services such as instant fiat deposits and withdrawals, fiat and crypto trading pairs, and OTC services, catering to both retail and institutional investors.

name: Bitbns
description: Founded in December 2017 by three partners. Rapidly became one of India's largest cryptocurrency trading platforms. Attracted over 500,000 users within its first year. Pioneered Bracket Orders in crypto trading. Offers advanced features like Margin Trading, Stop Limit, and Trailing Stop Limit. First Indian exchange to list more than 50 cryptocurrencies within a year of launch. Provides a P2P FIAT deposit and withdrawal system.

name: Bitci TR
description: Bitci TR, a centralized exchange founded in Turkey in 2018, boasts over 5 million registered users. The platform facilitates 24/7 Turkish Lira deposits and withdrawals through partnerships with seven Turkish banks. Bitci TR's current offering includes trading pairs with Turkish Lira and USDT. This exchange caters primarily to the Turkish market, providing a seamless interface between traditional banking and cryptocurrency trading.

name: FMFW.io
description: FMFW.io aims to empower global cryptocurrency trading for all skill levels. The platform offers over 400 trading pairs, high liquidity, and 24/7 multilingual support. Key features include cutting-edge matching engine technologies, up to 12x leverage for 29+ markets, a user-friendly terminal, tight spreads, and regular trading competitions. FMFW.io prioritizes security while providing an attractive platform for both novice and professional traders. The company's mission, reflected in its name 'Free the Money, Free the World,' is to facilitate easy and confident cryptocurrency trading worldwide.

name: Bitcoiva
description: Launched in June 2020, Bitcoiva is a fast-growing Indian crypto-trading platform that supports various transaction types. Distinctive features include instant INR withdrawals/deposits, high liquidity, and a simple user interface. Security is prioritized through KYC verification and it is accessible via a mobile app, offering 24/7 customer support. Bitcoiva also maintains a strong online presence and provides blog content for users.

name: Bitexen
description: Bitexen is a centralized cryptocurrency exchange based in Istanbul, Turkey. It launched on May 4, 2018, and has over 2 million estimated users. The exchange provides fiat on-off ramps for Turkish Lira and offers instant and pro trading features, along with 24/7 customer support. It uses its native token, BTXN, for lower fees and additional privileges. Designed for both novice and veteran traders, Bitexen offers a blend of services to cater to varied cryptocurrency trading demands in the Turkish market.

name: BITEXLIVE
description: BITEXLIVE is a centralized cryptocurrency exchange that began operations on June 30, 2017. The platform is headquartered in Uralsk, a city in the West Kazakhstan Region of Kazakhstan. Specifically, its address is located at House No. 174 on K. Amanzokolev Street, with a postal code of 090000. As a centralized exchange, BITEXLIVE likely offers a range of cryptocurrency trading services, including buying, selling, and potentially trading various digital assets. The exchange's location in Kazakhstan may influence its regulatory environment and user base.

name: Bitfinex
description: Bitfinex, founded in 2012, is a cryptocurrency exchange operated by iFinex Inc., based in Hong Kong. It caters to professional traders and institutions, offering fiat and crypto support, high liquidity for major cryptocurrencies, and advanced security features. Bitfinex provides various trading options, including margin trading, OTC, and derivatives. It supports over 270 cryptocurrencies and provides competitive fees with discounts for UNUS SED LEO token holders. Qualified users can trade with up to 10X leverage. Bitfinex restricts access to several countries, including the U.S., Canada, and certain regions. The platform's co-founders are Raphael Nicolle and Giancarlo Devasini, with the latter serving as CFO.

name: bitFlyer
description: bitFlyer is a Japanese crypto exchange with over 3 million users worldwide and €180 billion in global trading volume in 2021. Licensed in the EU, US, and Japan, it offers simple and advanced trading interfaces, spot and margin trading, crypto derivatives, and fast transactions. Founded in 2014 by former Goldman Sachs employees, bitFlyer is headquartered in Tokyo with a US subsidiary in San Francisco. The platform supports 11 digital assets, including popular cryptocurrencies like BTC, ETH, and LTC. Trading fees range from 0.1% to 0.2%, with some free trading options available. bitFlyer offers up to 2X leverage for margin trading on certain products, with potentially higher limits for corporate accounts.

name: Bitget
description: Seychelles-based cryptocurrency exchange serving over 20 million users in 100+ countries, providing services including spot, futures, margin trading, copy trading, and AI tools. Supports over 500 crypto tokens and 500+ trading pairs. Founded in 2018 and led by CEO Sandra Lou and Managing Director Gracy Chen. Offers leverage trading up to 125x for futures and 10x for spot. Provides competitive trading fees with discounts for BGB holders and VIP members. Recently rebranded with the philosophy 'Trade smarter'.

name: BitHash
description: A centralized cryptocurrency exchange based in Singapore, launched on June 23, 2016. Operated by PHOENIX TRADING SOLUTIONS LTD, a company incorporated in the Republic of Seychelles under the International Business Companies Act of 2016. It offers fiat deposits and withdrawals in USD, EUR, and RUB, OTC trading services, and an IEO launchpad platform.

name: Bithumb
description: Bithumb is a major South Korean crypto exchange with $205 million daily trading volume and 170+ listed cryptocurrencies. It offers bot trading, institutional accounts, liquidity access, passive income options, and 24/7 support. While unregulated, Bithumb is working towards compliance with international financial regulators. The platform requires account registration and implements security measures like OTP verification and AML checks. Founded in 2013 as Xcoin and rebranded in 2015, Bithumb aims to become a global blockchain-based financial corporation. The exchange supports 180+ digital assets and 280+ trading pairs, with transaction fees ranging from 0.04% to 0.25%. Bithumb does not offer leverage or margin trading.

name: Bitkub
description: Founded in February 2018, Bitkub is Thailand's leading digital asset and cryptocurrency exchange platform. It holds a license from the Thai SEC and operates with a registered capital of 450 million baht. The company is based in Bangkok and offers an array of services including cryptocurrency buying, selling, and storage. It supports Thai market traders, provides liquidity, and facilitates THB trade pairs for digital assets. Accessible via Android and iOS, Bitkub.com aims to cater to non-tech users by offering a user-friendly platform with features like multi-cryptocurrency wallets, technical analysis tools, and various cash-out options for businesses. Bitkub's mission is to be the most trusted and user-friendly cryptocurrency exchange in Thailand.

name: BitMart
description: BitMart is a centralized cryptocurrency exchange serving over 9 million users worldwide. It offers trading and investment services, including spot and futures trading, staking, lending, and margin trading with leverage. The platform supports 1000+ crypto assets with 700+ trading pairs, and provides a user-friendly interface, mobile app, and NFT marketplace. Founded in 2017 by Sheldon Xia and headquartered in the Cayman Islands, BitMart operates in over 180 countries but restricts access to certain regions. The exchange uses a tiered fee structure with a maker-taker model, starting at 0.25% for both makers and takers. The native token, BMX, was launched in 2018.

name: BitMEX
description: BitMEX is a P2P cryptocurrency exchange and derivatives trading platform founded in 2014, registered in Seychelles. It caters to advanced investors, offering leveraged tokens and margin trading. Key features include deep liquidity for Bitcoin perpetuals, professional trading dashboard, low fees, and cold storage security. The platform supports various cryptocurrencies for futures/perpetual contracts. Trading fees start at 0.025%, with no deposit or withdrawal fees. BitMEX offers up to 100x leverage on some products, with isolated and cross-margin trading options. The exchange is not available to U.S. residents and several other restricted countries. BitMEX was co-founded by Arthur Hayes, Samuel Reed, and Ben Delo, with a focus on advanced trading features and security.

name: Bitonic
description: Launched in 2013, BL3P is a product of Bitonic, a Dutch Bitcoin company founded in 2012. The exchange is available in all European countries. BL3P holds a Dutch bank account to process Euro transactions. BL3P is a fiat on-ramp for the Euro. European users can deposit and withdrawal Euro's through SEPA. Dutch users can deposit Euros through iDEAL and SEPA. The exchange has a fixed fee of 0,25% for both limit and market orders.

name: BitoPro
description: BitoPro is a centralized cryptocurrency exchange founded in Taiwan in March 2018. The platform offers trading pairs with the New Taiwan Dollar (TWD), providing local users with direct fiat-to-crypto trading options. As a centralized exchange, BitoPro likely offers features such as custodial wallet services, order matching, and compliance with local regulations. Its focus on TWD pairs suggests a primary target audience of Taiwanese crypto traders and investors.

name: Bitrue
description: Launched in July 2018, Bitrue is a top cryptocurrency exchange known for offering access to over 700 cryptocurrencies. The platform provides various services, including spot trading, futures, OTC, staking, copy trading, and more. It ranks highly in global trading volume, especially for XRP. Users can trade a wide range of cryptocurrency pairs, ETFs, and explore staking options offering up to 55% APR. It supports major cryptocurrencies such as BTC, ETH, XRP, and SOL, alongside fiat-to-crypto and crypto swapping services. The trading fees are between 0.098% and 0.28%, with potential discounts when using BTR, Bitrue's native currency. The platform also supports leverage trading and offers crypto derivative contracts, with a strong emphasis on security and customer protection.

name: Bitso
description: Bitso, founded in 2014, is Latin America's first regulated cryptocurrency platform with over 6 million global users. It offers a mobile app for buying, selling, and using cryptocurrencies, and Bitso Alpha, a high-liquidity exchange with advanced trading tools. Serving both institutional and retail clients, Bitso supports multiple currencies for on/off-ramps and on/off-books trading. Users can access the platform through Bitso Alpha or API, enabling complex automated trading strategies. Bitso lists 47 cryptocurrencies, including major coins like Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Ripple, as well as stablecoins and tokens.

name: Bitspay
description: A centralized cryptocurrency exchange launched in Estonia in January 2020. It is regulated under Estonia's Anti Money Laundering Counter-Terrorism Financing Act 2019. The platform emphasizes trust, security, and a pro-regulation stance, providing services to users from over 30 countries with a focus on Australia, New Zealand, and Singapore. Customers include individuals, businesses, trusts, and Self-Managed Superannuation Funds, with mandatory KYC procedures and tiered trading fees.

name: Bitstamp
description: Founded in 2011, Bitstamp is a regulation-centered, centralized crypto exchange expanded across more than 100 countries and serving over 4 million customers. With its operations on web, mobile, and API platforms, it avails trading access to 80 digital assets. Security remains a primary concern with 95% of crypto stored offline and 50 global licenses attained. Educational resources and 24/7 customer support further strengthen their offerings. Originally established in Slovenia by Damian Merlak and Nejc Kodrič, current leadership consists of seven compliance-focused professionals. Bitstamp accommodates prominent cryptocurrencies including BTC, ETH, and USDT utilizing a maker-taker fee structure adjusted according to 30-day trading volumes. Notably, it does not support leverage or margin trading.

name: Bitsten
description: Bitsten, launched in May 2018, is a centralized cryptocurrency exchange based in Indonesia. It supports Indonesian Rupiah (IDR) fiat currency pairs, allowing for cryptocurrency trading against the local currency. Offers typical exchange services such as trading and order matching; may include features like wallet services or market analysis tools.

name: BitStorage
description: BitStorage Exchange is a revolutionary cryptocurrency exchange created to provide users with a seamless and secure trading experience. The platform aims to simplify the process of trading cryptocurrencies, making it more accessible and reliable for users of all skill levels. Whether you are an experienced trader or just starting with crypto, the platform offers a user-friendly interface and cutting-edge security features to help trade with confidence.

name: BitTrade
description: BitTrade, formerly known as Huobi Japan, is a leading Japanese crypto exchange offering the most diverse coin selection in the country. The exchange employs a localization strategy and maintains ties with Huobi Group, utilizing their backend and security systems. It provides both simple swap and order book market services, catering to various user preferences. Operating as a licensed financial instruments business operator in Japan, BitTrade ensures regulatory compliance. It does not issue its own tokens but remains committed to serving the Japanese crypto market effectively through rebranding and growth.

name: BitTurk
description: BitTurk is a centralized cryptocurrency exchange based in Turkey, launched in September 2017.

name: Bitvavo
description: A leading European cryptocurrency exchange based in the Netherlands, offering over 200 digital assets with low trading fees. Founded in 2018, it serves over 1.5 million users. The exchange features staking, recurring buys, and an Account Guarantee program, with access through a mobile app, web, and API. Registered with the Dutch central bank, it prioritizes user security with a diverse team of over 250 members from 35 different nationalities. Supports various payment methods with competitive fees ranging from 0% to 0.25%. Does not offer leverage or margin trading.

name: Blockchain.com
description: Founded in 2011, Blockchain.com is a pioneering cryptocurrency infrastructure provider offering a blockchain explorer, API, and popular crypto wallet. It has processed over $1 trillion in crypto transactions, with one-third of all Bitcoin network transactions occurring through its platform. The company boasts 37 million verified users and 80 million wallets. Founded by Benjamin Reeves, Nicolas Cary, and Peter Smith, Blockchain.com launched its cryptocurrency exchange in July 2019. Headquartered in London with branches in Lithuania and the US, the platform supports 31 digital assets and offers a tiered fee structure based on trading volume. Margin trading is available for select users, but the service is restricted in several countries due to regulatory constraints.

name: Blocktrade
description: Blocktrade is a gamified crypto exchange offering a unique and engaging user experience. It includes features such as a level-up rewards system, NFT avatars, and leaderboards, which make investing enjoyable. Blocktrade ensures a seamless trading experience by offering zero trading fees, multilingual community support, extensive crypto education resources, and exceptional customer service. Serving as a versatile asset marketplace, it caters to users looking for excitement in their trades or a reliable investment platform. The platform merges financial and gaming elements to create an appealing environment for both novice and seasoned crypto enthusiasts.

name: BTC-Alpha
description: A licensed European cryptocurrency exchange launched in 2016, offering trading services globally. Registered in Lithuania, with offices in Cyprus, Switzerland, and Ukraine. Features a native ERC-20 token, ALP. Provides social listing, API access, and multilingual support. Mobile apps available for Android and iOS.

name: BTC Markets
description: BTC Markets, launched in July 2013, is a Melbourne-based digital asset exchange. It offers trading pairs in AUD and BTC with tiered fees and free AUD deposits/withdrawals. Features include a trading API, advanced order types, tax reporting, and batch order management. The platform complies with AUSTRAC-regulated AML/CTF legislation under the Anti Money Laundering Counter-Terrorism Financing Act 2018.

name: BTCC
description: Founded in 2011, BTCC is a long-standing cryptocurrency exchange offering futures trading on over 300 cryptocurrencies with up to 225x leverage. Known for its security, BTCC has had zero incidents since inception and is PCI DSS compliant. With 2.1 million users worldwide, it's accessible globally except in restricted countries. BTCC supports major coins, fan tokens, memecoins, and tokenized futures of commodities and stocks. The platform has a tiered fee structure with maker and taker fees as low as 0% and 0.01% respectively. Higher VIP levels offer discounts and exclusive perks. BTCC aims to make crypto trading reliable and accessible for everyone.

name: BtcTurk | Kripto
description: Launched in 2013, BtcTurk is a centralized exchange based in Istanbul, Turkey. It claims to be the first exchange of its kind in Turkey and the worldâ€™s fourth Bitcoin and cryptocurrency exchange platform. BtcTurk claims to serve more than 5 million registered users and allows Turkish Lira deposits and withdrawals through its integration with seven Turkish banks â€“ this service is available 24 hours a day, seven days a week. BtcTurk currently offers Turkish Lira and USDT pairs. Those signed up to BtcTurk | Kripto can trade with Turkish users, enjoy lower exchange fees and withdraw Bitcoin without any transfer fees.

name: BTSE
description: A digital asset exchange established in 2018, catering to both institutional and retail investors. It offers a variety of services including spot and derivatives trading, an NFT marketplace, OTC trading, asset management, and payment gateways. The exchange supports over 150 cryptocurrencies and 12 fiat currencies without imposing withdrawal limits. Featuring a robust 10-tier VIP fee structure and staking rewards, BTSE provides leveraged trading up to 100x on perpetual futures and 20x on dated futures, along with advanced order types and multi-asset collateral options to enhance trading strategies. Users benefit from cross and isolated wallets, sub-accounts, enhanced risk management features, and strict security protocols backed by an insurance fund.

name: Buda
description: Buda.com is an exchange and wallet from Latin-America, with operations in Argentina, Chile (HQ), Colombia and Peru. Buda is reportedly backed by DCG.

name: Bunicorn
description: Bunicorn is a decentralized exchange on Binance Smart Chain offering innovative features. It provides flexible AMM pools supporting up to 8 tokens with customizable weights, amplified pools for efficient stablecoin swaps, and Liquidity Bootstrapping Pools. The platform employs smart order routing for optimized pricing and dynamic fees based on volatility. Liquidity providers can join multi-token pools with a single asset. Bunicorn's unique high APY yield farming model vests earned rewards as NFT collectibles. These features combine to create a versatile and efficient decentralized trading experience on the Binance Smart Chain.

name: BXH
description: BXH is a comprehensive DeFi platform operating on multiple blockchain networks, including BSC, Heco chain, Ethereum, and OKExChain. Its primary focus is on aggregate revenue generation, complemented by a decentralized trading platform. As a one-stop solution, BXH aims to provide users with a range of DeFi services and opportunities within a single ecosystem. The platform's multi-chain approach allows for increased accessibility and potential for cross-chain interactions, catering to a diverse user base across different blockchain networks. By combining revenue aggregation with decentralized trading, BXH offers a versatile DeFi experience that addresses various user needs and preferences in the evolving blockchain landscape.

name: Bybit
description: Bybit, founded in 2018 by Ben Zhou, is a cryptocurrency centralized exchange offering spot trading, derivatives, NFT marketplace, and other services. It serves over 10 million users globally, except in restricted countries like the U.S. and China. Headquartered in Dubai, Bybit supports 100+ crypto tokens and 300+ trading pairs. The platform uses a tiered fee structure based on a maker-taker model, with non-VIP users paying 0.10% for spot trading and 0.06% (taker) / 0.01% (maker) for derivatives. Bybit offers up to 100X leverage on derivatives products and supports both isolated and cross margin trading.

name: BYDFi
description: A cryptocurrency trading platform established in 2019, offering professional, convenient, and innovative trading services. Their mission is to revolutionize cryptocurrency trading and empower users striving for autonomy and contributing to the cryptocurrency sector's development.

name: C-Patex
description: C-Patex is an Argentinian cryptocurrency exchange launched in November 2014. It offers trading for a moderate selection of cryptocurrencies, focusing primarily on well-established digital assets. The platform caters to the Argentine market, providing access to major digital currencies for local users.

name: Capital DEX
description: Capital DEX is a decentralized exchange that began operations on December 25, 2020. It is dedicated to security tokens and uses an Automated Market Maker (AMM) algorithm on the Ethereum network to enable ERC-20 token trading. The platform is also focused on developing infrastructure for user KYC procedures to ensure legal protection and safe handling of security tokens.

name: Cat.Ex
description: Cat.Ex, founded in August 2018, is a centralized cryptocurrency exchange with a global presence in countries like Brazil, Vietnam, South Korea, Bangladesh, Russia, Turkey, the Middle East, India, Indonesia, and the United States. It features staking, farming, and multiple faucets backed by SNA and microservice-based distributed architecture for efficient horizontal scaling, enhancing performance and reliability for user activity and transaction volumes.

name: CEX.IO
description: Established in 2013, a leading cryptocurrency platform focused on global financial inclusion through blockchain technology. It supports digital asset management activities like buying, storing, trading, selling, sending, and earning cryptocurrencies for various clients, including retail, enterprise, and institutional. Known for secure, user-friendly access to decentralized finance, CEX.IO aims at the widespread adoption of digital assets with innovative tools and technologies.

name: Changelly PRO
description: Launched on June 7, 2020, as a centralized exchange based in Seychelles. It's a professional upgrade to the Changelly instant swap platform, offering spot and margin trading, along with fiat on-ramp solutions. It serves experienced traders and helps beginners transition to advanced trading practices.

name: CherrySwap
description: CherrySwap is an automatic market-making protocol on OKExChain (OEC) that utilizes the Automated Market Maker (AMM) mechanism.

name: Chiliz
description: Chiliz.net is the trading platform for all the sports & entertainment tokens partnered with Chiliz ($CHZ) and Socios.com. It includes FC Barcelona, Juventus, Paris Saint-Germain, Galatasaray, AS Roma, OG (esports DOTA2) and many more. Chiliz is a European blockchain-based venture based in Malta with 60+ people. The exchange and trading resources are based in Singapore and across Asia.

name: CITEX
description: A comprehensive cryptocurrency management platform with various services like spot trading, mining, investment opportunities, incubation services, OTC trading, earning options, and derivatives trading. Focuses on security, convenience, and innovation, providing effective tools for cryptocurrency asset management.

name: Clipper (Ethereum)
description: Clipper is a decentralized exchange (DEX) built for self-made traders instead of hedge funds. Clipper was designed to give traders the best prices anywhere (including fees, slippage and gas) for their small trades (under $10,000) on the pairs they trade the most.

name: Coinbase Exchange
description: A US-based crypto trading platform founded in 2012 by Brian Armstrong and Fred Ehrsam. It offers buying, selling, and storing of over 150 cryptocurrencies. Transitioning from Coinbase Pro to 'Advanced Trade' on its main app. Available in over 100 countries. Fees range from 0-0.60% based on trading volume. Margin trading was discontinued in 2020 due to regulatory changes.

name: Coincheck
description: Coincheck is a Japanese cryptocurrency exchange regulated by Japan's Financial Services Agency, supporting 17 major cryptocurrencies. Founded in 2012 and acquired by Monex Group in 2018, it offers services like OTC trading, IEOs, bill payments with Bitcoin, and an NFT marketplace. Headquartered in Tokyo, it serves over 1.5 million clients, but does not support U.S. investors or offer margin trading.

name: CoinDCX
description: An Indian cryptocurrency exchange launched in 2018, known for offering fast fiat-to-crypto conversions with zero fees. It supports diverse crypto products and the highest number of listed cryptocurrencies in India. Notable for rapid onboarding, minimal fees, and instant transactions.

name: CoinEx
description: CoinEx is a global crypto exchange offering diverse services including spot, futures, and margin trading, AMM, and crypto finance. Founded in 2017 by Haipo Yang, it supports over 600 cryptocurrencies and serves 4 million users in 200+ countries. CoinEx prioritizes user-friendly interfaces, security, and transparency, implementing a "Merkle Tree" audit method for Proof of Reserve. The platform offers up to 10X leverage and 110+ futures markets. As part of ViaBTC Group, CoinEx contributes to a comprehensive crypto ecosystem. The CoinEx Ambassador program allows partners to assist in global promotion, offering commissions up to 50% of referees' transaction fees and lifetime rewards for active ambassadors.

name: CoinJar
description: CoinJar, founded in 2013, is a cryptocurrency platform that allows for buying, selling, and spending digital assets. Registered with UK's FCA, the platform has processed billions in transactions and partners with Premier League's Brentford FC and Melbourne Demons. It provides user-friendly mobile apps, professional trading services, and supports instant deposits/withdrawals in AUD and GBP. CoinJar offers competitive fees, starting at 0% for market orders, and supports 30 cryptocurrencies. The CoinJar Card Mastercard enables crypto-to-fiat purchases, and CoinJar Clear offers white-label financial solutions. CoinJar aims to make cryptocurrencies accessible and easy-to-use for everyone.

name: Coinlist Pro
description: Launched in July 2020 in San Francisco as a centralized exchange. Supports fiat and crypto pairs, including Filecoin at mainnet launch. Offers wBTC/BTC minting/burning and staking for assets like CELO, ALGO, and XTZ. Regulated as a FinCEN-registered Money Services Business, operating as a money transmitter in over 40 US states and internationally.

name: Coinmate
description: Coinmate has prioritized reliability, simplicity, and safety in cryptocurrency trading since 2014. It operates physical offices in Prague and Zlín, Czech Republic, adhering to Czech and EU regulations. Their customer support is available on weekdays, highlighting their commitment to client service and accessibility.

name: Coinone
description: Coinone is a South Korean crypto exchange founded in 2014 and launched in 2015. It offers trading of over 200 digital assets, focusing on Asian clients. Key features include a user-friendly interface, secure wallet, fiat and crypto deposits, and 24/7 support. The platform provides simplified, professional, and quick trading options, as well as staking. Founded by Myunghun Cha, a cybersecurity expert, Coinone is headquartered in Seoul. The exchange primarily targets South Korean investors, supporting KRW as its only fiat option. Coinone charges a flat fee of 0.2% for the main market, with maker fees ranging from 0-0.1% and taker fees from 0.02-0.1%. Margin trading was removed in 2017 due to regulatory concerns.

name: Coinsbit
description: An Estonia-based centralized exchange established in August 2018 with a broad user base of 2 million. It offers various services such as cryptocurrency trading, multiple fiat gateways, OTC trading, P2P-lending, and staking. Coinsbit introduced the CNB token in January 2020 to reduce trading fees and supports listings and IEOs. Legally registered as Coinsbit Inc. in Seychelles.

name: Coinstore
description: Established in 2020 as a global crypto asset trading platform focused on high-growth emerging markets. Serves over 5.1 million users in 175 countries with services such as spot and futures trading, Launchpad, earn features, and wallet services. Aims to lead the exchange space in emerging markets by 2025.

description: CoinSwap Space, launched in April 2021, is a decentralized exchange (DEX) on the Binance Smart Chain using an Automated Market Maker (AMM) model. It facilitates the trading of BEP20 tokens against liquidity pools and enables yield farming. The platform offers smart routing for optimal swaps and allows token staking for additional rewards, alongside providing a low-fee alternative to Ethereum-based exchanges.

name: CoinTiger
description: Launched in 2017, CoinTiger is a Singapore-based centralized exchange supporting CNY transactions. It introduced an equity mechanism with its TigerCash token, allocating 50% of 2018 profits to holders. The platform offers web and mobile applications, with services including trading, IEO voting, and Labs. By mid-2019, it claimed 2 million users across 100 countries. KYC is optional for most users but required for fiat trading or large withdrawals. API documentation is available for market information and trading.

description: CoinW is a leading crypto trading platform launched in 2017, known for its security, transparency, and user-centric approach. Basic fees for makers and takers are 0.2%. Founded by experts in crypto, cybersecurity, and finance, CoinW employs over 1,000 professionals from 30 countries, emphasizing global reach and regulatory compliance to advance the crypto industry.

name: CoinZoom
description: A centralized cryptocurrency exchange based in Salt Lake City, Utah, USA. Launched on January 3, 2020, and offers services including fiat currency pairs, deposits, and withdrawals. It is licensed and registered with the Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN) as a money services business.

name: Convergence
description: Convergence is pioneering as the first Automated Market Maker (AMM) to make private assets interchangeable in DeFi by fractionalizing them through a user-friendly interface. This innovation allows asset owners to tap into DeFi's liquidity, while DeFi users gain access to previously unavailable real-world assets. By combining a lower investment entry barrier with DeFi's liquidity, automation, and transparency, Convergence Finance democratizes access to exotic real-world assets. This platform bridges the gap between traditional finance and DeFi, making private assets more accessible and liquid while expanding investment opportunities for DeFi participants.

name: Crypto.com Exchange
description: Launched in 2019, based in Singapore, serving over 50 million customers globally. Offers a mobile app, Visa card, wallet, and NFT services. Supports spot, margin, and derivatives trading with 250+ digital assets, 20 fiat currencies. Tiered fees based on trading volume and CRO staking. Margin trading up to 10X leverage; derivatives up to 100X leverage. Available in most US states and many other countries, with restrictions. Founded by Kris Marszalek on the Crypto.org chain; native token is Cronos (CRO).

name: Cryptonex
description: Cryptonex, established in 2017 in the UK, offers a comprehensive suite of cryptocurrency services, including an exchange, p2p platform, multi-currency wallet, and card services. Founded by experienced financial software developers, Cryptonex aims to simplify crypto adoption. The platform employs cold storage for security and supports multiple fiat currencies. Deposits can be made via various methods, with mandatory KYC for fiat transactions. Exchange fees range from 0.1% to 0.01% for VIP users. Cryptonex is accessible via website and mobile apps, and also provides its technologies to other market participants.

name: Currency.com
description: A regulated tokenized securities exchange offering a platform for trading cryptocurrencies and over 2000 tokenized assets including stocks, indices, commodities, and FX pairs, tradable with crypto or fiat.

name: Dcoin
description: A global digital asset and derivatives trading platform launched in March 2018. It serves over 3.5 million users across 110+ regions and aims to offer exceptional trading experiences with industry-standard practices, cutting-edge technology, and efficient matching algorithms. Dcoin's focus is on becoming a trusted cryptocurrency trading platform with a strong emphasis on technical excellence and user satisfaction.

name: Deepcoin
description: A Singapore-based centralized exchange offering spot trading, derivatives, and other financial services. Founded in 2018 by Eagle Huang, it primarily targets the Asian market. Claims to have obtained regulatory licenses in the US and Canada. Supports 216 trading pairs, including popular cryptocurrencies and fiat currencies. Headquartered in Singapore with branches in several countries. Restricts users from certain jurisdictions, including the US and Hong Kong. Offers competitive fees, with spot trading currently free. Margin trading available with up to 125x leverage. Provides innovative products like Super Saving and Lucky Money.

name: DeFiChain DEX
description: DeFiChain DEX is an audited, decentralized exchange launched in November 2020. It offers swaps between DFI, BTC, ETH, and USDT with yields over 300% APY. Uses Bitcoin's blockchain for security. No vulnerabilities found by SlowMist and KnownSec audits.

name: Delta Exchange
description: Delta Exchange, founded in 2018, is a crypto derivatives platform offering Futures, Perpetual Swaps, and Options on Bitcoin and over 50 Altcoins with up to 100x leverage. Backed by notable investors, Delta provides innovative products like Calendar Spreads and Interest Rate Swaps. The exchange boasts cheap volatility and tight spreads in Options, featuring unique offerings such as Straddles and Turbo Options on various cryptocurrencies. Delta aims to deliver an optimal trading experience through its robust engine and diverse product range. Traders can access Futures and Options markets via provided links. For community engagement, Delta maintains active Telegram and Twitter channels.

name: Deribit
description: Launched in June 2016, is a cryptocurrency trading platform specializing in futures and options. Based in Amsterdam, the company offers advanced trading services for digital assets, focusing on derivatives products. As a specialized platform, it caters to more experienced traders seeking sophisticated financial instruments in the crypto market. The platform's emphasis on futures and options sets it apart from many other cryptocurrency exchanges, which primarily offer spot trading. Its location in Amsterdam positions it within the European financial ecosystem, potentially influencing its regulatory approach and market focus.

name: Dex-Trade
description: Founded in 2017 and registered in Belize, Dex-Trade is a centralized cryptocurrency exchange. It offers safe trading with low commissions, catering to both novice and expert traders. The platform provides high liquidity, minimal spreads, a demo mode for strategy testing, and 24/7 customer support. Dex-Trade also offers listing and promotion services, leveraging market-making tools and is headquartered in Belize City, Belize. Mobile apps are available for Android and iOS devices.

name: Dfyn Network
description: Dfyn is a Layer-2 AMM is a permissionless decentralized exchange (DEX) based on Ethereum, powered by Matic Networkâ€™s Layer 2 scalability infrastructure. By utilizing Layer 2 for transactions, Dfyn users will be able to trade any ERC20 asset at lightning-fast speeds with near-zero gas costs.

name: DigiFinex
description: DigiFinex, founded in 2017 and headquartered in Singapore, is a global digital currency trading platform. It offers trading in mainstream and smaller cryptocurrencies with services like leveraged trading, OTC trading, and asset custody. Features include margin trading up to 5X leverage and perpetual contracts up to 100X leverage. Known for strong security measures and KYC processes, it has no reported hacks. Despite restrictions in some countries like the US and China, it recently launched a service for Canadian users.

name: digitalexchange.id
description: A centralized crypto exchange platform based in Indonesia. Established in 2018 and launched in 2019, it aims to become the largest Indonesian crypto exchange supporting IDR trading pairs. Officially registered with BAPPEBTI and KOMINFO, it offers over 60 crypto assets as of May 2023, accessible via mobile apps on Google Play and App Store.

name: dYdX
description: dYdX is a leading non-custodial decentralized exchange (DEX) focused on advanced crypto derivatives, particularly perpetuals. It launched its native token, $DYDX, in August 2021 for governance and trader rewards. Utilizing StarkWare's StarkEx scalability engine, the platform operates on a layer 2 protocol for efficiency. Headquartered in San Francisco, with a foundation in Zug, Switzerland, dYdX supports popular trading pairs like Ethereum, Bitcoin, and Solana. Features include a maker-taker fee structure and leveraged trading up to 20X for BTC and ETH markets. Plans are in motion to launch an independent blockchain based on Cosmos SDK.

name: Ecxx

Its focus on regulatory compliance and privileged access to official identity data enhances its capability to streamline user verification processes, positioning it as a trustworthy and secure trading platform.

name: FameEX
description: FameEX is a global derivatives trading platform founded in 2018 by Lee BoonGin. The platform offers spot, grid, margin, futures, and options trading for cryptocurrencies. It includes features such as AI-recommended order placement, online futures calculators, and grid trading bots.

name: Felixo
description: Felixo is a centralized cryptocurrency exchange launched in October 2018 and based in Turkey. It offers trading pairs with the Turkish Lira (TRY), facilitating the exchange of digital assets using the local fiat currency. The platform manages user funds and transactions through a centralized entity, serving primarily the Turkish market.

name: Finexbox
description: Finexbox is a centralized cryptocurrency exchange based in Hong Kong, launched in October 2018. It is described as a comprehensive spot trading platform for digital assets. The exchange offers leveraged margin trading with up to 3.3x leverage through a peer-to-peer funding market. This feature is intended to amplify gains for traders, though it also increases risk. The platform includes a variety of tools and services tailored for both novice and experienced traders in the cryptocurrency market.

name: Flybit
description: Flybit, launched on March 15, 2019, is a centralized cryptocurrency exchange headquartered in Seoul, Korea. It allows for deposits and withdrawals in Korean Won (KRW) and cryptocurrencies. The platform is designed for user-friendliness with enhanced security measures and higher liquidity. Supporting KRW transactions, it is especially accessible to Korean users and those interested in trading in Korean currency.

name: FOBLGATE

As a centralized exchange, FOBLGATE likely offers a range of trading services for various digital assets, providing a platform for users to buy, sell, and trade cryptocurrencies. name: Foxbit
description: Foxbit is a São Paulo-based bitcoin and cryptocurrency company with a mission to revolutionize the financial market.

name: Gate.io
description: Gate.io is a centralized cryptocurrency exchange launched in 2013. The platform reports a daily trading volume exceeding $12 billion and offers a range of services with features like a mobile app and 24/7 support. Founded by Lin Han in China, it is now based in the Cayman Islands and available globally with certain restrictions. A KYC process is mandatory for transaction activities, and the exchange maintains competitive fees. Margin trading provides up to 10X leverage, and the exchange incorporates a tiered VIP system for trading fees, although it lacks regulation and fiat withdrawal capability.

name: Gemini
description: A regulated cryptocurrency exchange available in over 60 countries, offering 80+ cryptocurrencies and 21+ trading pairs. Founded by Tyler and Cameron Winklevoss in 2015. It caters to both beginners and advanced traders with a focus on security and compliance.

name: Giottus
description: Giottus is revolutionizing digital asset trading in India with a customer-centric platform. It offers high ratings, a proprietary order processing engine, insurance protection, fast KYC processing, 24/7 banking support, multilingual customer service, trading in 100+ cryptocurrency pairs, a highly liquid spot exchange focusing on INR pairs, and a one-click buy option.

name: Globe Derivative Exchange
description: As a second-generation cryptocurrency derivatives exchange, Globe has had time to learn from the missteps of the previous generation Globe has a unique exchange architecture to tackle this - Matching and risk engines run in colocation on high frequency trading hardware - This allows for the entire orderbook to be kept in L3 cache at all times and nanosecond latencies between services yielding faster-than-NASDAQ message processing rates to avoid overloads - Globe also benefits from the huge expense invested into fast connections between major financial data centers like London (LD4) and Tokyo, meaning that Globe can offer superior global lag characteristics and throughput to previous generation exchanges

name: Hanbitco
description: A regulation-ready Korean exchange launched in 2018. It has notable certifications and rankings for cybersecurity. Founding member of the Korea Blockchain Association (KBA). Played a significant role in shaping self-regulatory requirements for Korean exchanges. CEOs held leadership positions within the KBA Exchange Committee. Initiated the ChainAction social movement in 2018, focusing on aligning blockchain projects with UN Sustainable Development Goals and promoting cryptocurrency adoption. Demonstrates commitment to regulatory compliance, industry leadership, and social responsibility in the blockchain ecosystem.

name: HashKey Exchange
description: Hong Kong's first licensed retail virtual asset exchange, focusing on compliance, safety, and security. Offers fiat-to-crypto trading, segregated client funds, and custody-grade insurance. ISO 27001 and ISO 27701 certified.

name: HitBTC
description: HitBTC, established in 2013, is a global cryptocurrency exchange offering over 800 trading pairs and various services. It provides multiple APIs and a sophisticated UI for advanced traders, along with a tiered fee system. Security measures include cold storage, encryption, 2-factor authentication, and whitelists. The platform has improved its technical capabilities and reduced latency. HitBTC serves both individual and corporate clients, with offices in major cities worldwide. The exchange offers exchange, custodial, and related services, catering to demanding traders while prioritizing user security and platform efficiency.

name: Honeyswap
description: Honeyswap is a decentralized exchange (DEX) on the xDai chain, replicating UniSwap V2. It uses an automated market maker model and is governed by the 1hive community using the HNY token. Liquidity providers can deposit tokens and receive LP tokens. The exchange supports token swaps, flash loans, and oracles. Users must bridge ERC-20 tokens from Ethereum to xDai. Launched in September 2020, Honeyswap is managed by a decentralized autonomous organization (DAO) with no central location. While there are no formal restrictions, users from US-sanctioned countries may face limitations. The exchange supports ERC-20 tokens and charges a 0.3% fee for swaps. Leverage and margin trading are not available.

name: HTX
description: HTX is a comprehensive blockchain ecosystem offering digital asset trading, financial derivatives, wallets, research, investments, and incubation services. It supports spot, futures, and margin trading with earn products, custody services, and trading bots. Founded by Leon Li in 2013 as Huobi Global, it rebranded to HTX in 2022.

name: IDEX
description: IDEX is a decentralized exchange combining the best of traditional order books and automated market makers. This hybrid system uses on-chain settlement and off-chain trading to minimize failed trades and reduce gas fees. IDEX safeguards against front-running and sandwich attacks while enabling advanced order types and arbitrage opportunities. Liquidity is provided by both AMM and user limit orders. Smart contracts are employed to decentralize custody and settlement, enhancing fund security. Founded by Alex and Phil Wearn in 2017, the company operates out of Panama and adheres to legal regulations. IDEX supports a wide range of major cryptocurrencies and ERC-20 tokens, implementing a 0.25% taker fee, with future plans to introduce leverage trading.

name: Independent Reserve
description: Independent Reserve, launched in October 2013, is a Sydney-based centralized exchange. It supports AUD, NZD, and USD pairs. As a platform regulated by AUSTRAC, it focuses on serving users primarily from Australia, New Zealand, and Singapore while expanding to over 30 countries. In January 2020, Independent Reserve made a strategic expansion to Singapore to seek MAS licensing. Known for its emphasis on regulation, trust, and security, the exchange has offered insurance coverage for digital assets since February 2019. Notable features include a KPMG tax calculator, auto trading options, Bloomberg price feeds, and an API for automated trading. Services cater to individuals, businesses, trusts, and Self-Managed Super Funds (SMSFs), with a mandatory Know Your Customer (KYC) policy and a system of tiered trading fees. The company strives to maintain a reputation as a trusted and secure platform for cryptocurrency trading within its target markets.
